lexUnit.name: run.v

corpus.description: Texts from Nuclear Threat Initiative website, created by Center for Non-Proliferation Studies
corpus.name: NTI

lexUnit.definition: COD: be in charge of; manage or organize.

sentence.text: Because it 's she who runs that business , not you .
` If you were a secretary , you can probably be a manager or even run your own business .
While Gloria helped dry the dishes after tea , Mrs Parvis continued to find fault with the people who ran the country .
But I do n't know how you can run a country on frothy money , and I would argue that Black Wednesday was a classic example of that sort of thing going wrong . "
If he runs the country as well as he ran the campaign we 'll be alright . "
` These two were running the show , " said Cowley coldly .
You 'd be given free rein to run the show how you wanted it .
Remember , the Richardson 's have run gangs in Deptford since the war .
There is a similar organisation that runs projects in Scotland ; and the National Trust also uses volunteers in many aspects of its work .
` You used to run a little photographic shop in Silmour Street , " Connor remembered .
You could be running the most ecologically sound enterprise in the whole of Brazil , but you would still have an illegal road going across Indian land . "
The prime ministers between the World Wars , who were mostly Conservative , ran the system with sense and responsibility .
They run their own lives with the assistance of a support worker .
Now the theatre trust is seeking an management company to run it for them .
You may contribute to running the Home by attending its residents ' committee meetings .
Geoff Boucher has been running this unofficial sanctuary for more than four years .
The Centre for Alternative Technology , a charity , has run a working exhibition on ` low impact technologies " since 1974 .
The front row on the left was taken by the two light-skinned women who ran the Primary School .
Communities were typically run by the ` ancientry of the parish . "
The nursery is run by trained staff under the supervision of the matron .
As you know , I run the magazine on a pretty tight budget , but I could offer a fee of 100 if you could supply two or three good quality photographs with your article .

On 18 December 1997 , the Islamic Republic News Agency ( IRNA ) reported that the Eastern railroad network , run by the Bonyad-e Mostazafan va Janbazan , has purchased 100 tank cars from Ukraine , specifically designed to transport highly toxic chemicals .
